Bedford resident Bruce Willis walked onto the "Tonight Show" stage on Friday wearing a blond, comb over wig inspired by a certain Republican presidential candidate. Dressed in a blue suit and red tie, the actor kept a straight face when questioned by host Jimmy Fallon about his Trump-tastic tresses. "It suddenly has just seemed to grow exponentially," he explained. "I was a blonde when I was a kid." "A lot of times I'll start off with hair [in movie roles] and I'll just shave it.... Nice and shiny, I don't have to worry about it," the "Die Hard" star, who will star in Broadways "Misery," told Fallon. Watch the clip below for a laugh:

>

Maybe Willis was just trying on his Halloween costume a couple of weeks early. His wife Emma Heming-Willis is already getting in the Halloween spirit with a Westchester tradition. The parenting blogger shared photos on Instagram from her visit to The Great Jack O'Lantern Blaze in Croton-on-Hudson. Photo: NBC
